page.title: 08Harpers Brook
page.content: Harpers Brook flows through the parish of Brigstock. It rises from some small springs north of Desborough and flows some 15 miles in an easterly direction. It passes through the grounds of what was once{Pipewell {Abbey}and was mentioned in 1135 by the monks there as Harpers Broke. It joins the river Nene about 1\ miles from Thrapston. In Brigstock full use was made of the water, the moat round the Manor House was filled from the brook. it also supplied the royal fish ponds which were situated on the north side of Bridge Street in the meadow known as Fish Pond Meadow. On its banks were tannyards and later a fellmonger all of which made use of the water. There was a water mill mentioned in the Doomsday Book. At the beginning of the century, perch, roach, dace and eels were found in the water.
